channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: Stocks Fall Late on US Downgrade as Yields Climb: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks dropped in late hours and bond yields climbed after the US was downgraded by Moody’s Ratings amid concerns about the increase in government debt that threatens America’s status as the world’s safe haven.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Mehvish Ayub on Trade War, Trump Administration, China Stocks
item.description: Mehvish Ayub Bank of Singapore Executive Director of Investment Solutions Mehvish Ayub discusses the trade war between China and US, the Trump administration's handling of financial markets, and Chinese stocks. She speaks with Joumanna Bercetche on "Bloomberg Horizons Middle East and Africa." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Space, Defense Firm Voyager Technologies Files Publicly for IPO
item.description: Voyager Technologies Inc. filed publicly for an initial public offering, as it seeks to capitalize on rising government spending on advanced defense technologies and space exploration.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, April 23, 2025. Signs Donald Trump is rethinking the most-aggressive elements of his combative stances on trade and the Federal Reserve sent stocks to the first back-to-back gains since his tariff war escalated, while soothing volatility across asset classes. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Monica Defend on US Dollar, Fed Cuts, Gold
item.description: Amundi Investment Institute Head Monica Defend discusses how they were surprised with the US Dollar as it correlated with the equity market. In an interview with Francine Lacqua she says she believes the fed will make three cuts this year, they're staying neutral on China, and overweight in gold. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Loses Last Top Credit Rating With Downgrade From Moody’s
item.description: The US was stripped of its last top credit rating by Moody’s Ratings, reflecting deepening concern that ballooning debt and deficits will damage America’s standing as the preeminent destination for global capital and increase the government’s borrowing costs.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie

item.title: Batista Brothers to Back Out of Talks for Banco Master Assets
item.description: Joesley and Wesley Batista, the brothers who control meat giant JBS SA through their family holding J&F Investimentos SA, are no longer in talks to acquire some of Banco Master’s assets amid lingering concerns over the lender’s financial stability, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Gamarski, Gerson Freitas Jr

item.title: Wall Street Strategists React to Moody’s US Credit Rating Cut
item.description: US stocks declined and Treasury yields rose after Moody’s Ratings downgraded the US credit rating, citing an increase in government debt and a higher interest burden.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova, Carmen Reinicke, Anya Andrianova

item.title: Asian Currencies May Chart Different Paths After Recent Rally
item.description: Asian currencies are set to take divergent paths after a collective rally against the dollar, as investors navigate trade uncertainty and growth concerns about the world’s top two economies.
item.dc:creator: Malavika Kaur Makol, Bhaskar Dutta

item.title: MAGA Accounts Aren't the Worst Idea
item.description: Trump's so-called “MAGA accounts” have some promising features, but they risk becoming another expensive way for the government to paper over its existing policy failures, explains Bloomberg Opinion columnist Allison Schrager. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Notches Weekly Gain on Big Tech Strength, Trade Optimism
item.description: US stocks delivered their second-best weekly gain of the year on Friday, as Big Tech fueled a rally that brought the S&P 500 Index closer to an all-time high set nearly three months ago.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: The Nasdaq MarketSite in New York.

item.title: Emerging-Market Assets Notch Up Fifth Consecutive Weekly Gain
item.description: Emerging-market assets edged lower Friday as softer economic data in the US raised concerns around growth in the world’s largest economy.
item.dc:creator: Leda Alvim, Raphael Almeida Dos Santos

media:content.media:description: Gojek drivers in front of exchange rates displayed at a currency exchange office in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Wednesday, March 26, 2025. Analysts see Indonesia’s rupiah declining to a record low in the short term as political and economic worries continue to grow in Southeast Asia’s biggest economy. Photographer: Dimas Ardian/Bloomberg

item.title: Saks Creditors Form Majority Group Ahead of Potential Debt Talks
item.description: Saks Global Enterprises creditors that hold more than half of its $2.2 billion bond due 2029 have organized and are preparing for potential talks with the company regarding its financing options, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu, Eliza Ronalds-Hannon, Jill R Shah

media:content.media:description: A shopper carries a Saks Fifth Avenue bag in New York, US, on Thursday, April 11, 2024. The US Census Bureau is scheduled to release retail sales figures on April 15.

item.title: Battered Wall Street Short Brigade Is Refusing to Admit Defeat
item.description: Just like that, the panic on Wall Street has vanished almost as quickly as it arrived.
item.dc:creator: Lu Wang

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100 Close Higher | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Grim Outlooks Take Centerstage as Tariffs Loom: Earnings Watch
item.description: One thing is clear as the first-quarter earnings season draws to a close: The uncertain outlook for the global economy is superseding better-than-feared results even as stocks rally on signs of easing trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey, Sagarika Jaisinghani

item.title: Binance, Kraken Are Said to Have Been Targets of Hacks
item.description: Binance and Kraken are among major crypto exchanges that have been targeted by the same type of social-engineering hack that was recently disclosed by Coinbase Global Inc., according to people familiar with the situation.
item.dc:creator: Olga Kharif, Teresa Xie

media:content.media:description: The Kraken application for download in the Apple App Store on a smartphone arranged in Dobbs Ferry, New York, U.S., on Saturday, May 22, 2021. Elon Musk continued to toy with the price of Bitcoin Monday, taking to Twitter to indicate support for what he says is an effort by miners to make their operations greener. Photographer: Tiffany Hagler-Geard/Bloomberg

item.title: Banco do Brasil Rout Sheds $3.7 Billion as Guidance Pulled
item.description: Banco do Brasil SA shed 21 billion reais ($3.7 billion) in market value Friday in its worst session in five years after the Brazilian lender put parts of its 2025 forecast under review and reported rising delinquency rates on agricultural loans that took a bite out of first-quarter profit.
item.dc:creator: Raphael Almeida Dos Santos, Leda Alvim, Peter Frontini

media:content.media:description: A Banco do Brasil branch in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on Thursday, May 4, 2023. Banco do Brasil SA is expected to release earning figures on May 10. Photographer: Lucas Landau/Bloomberg

item.title: Wall Street Is Down on the Dollar as Trade Unease Lingers
item.description: In a week that saw an epic rally in US stocks and recession calls cast aside, currency traders are just as bearish as ever on the American dollar.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Tajitsu, Carter Johnson, Anya Andrianova

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk along Wall Street across from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. US stocks traded steady, reversing gains from earlier in the day, as Wall Street traders weighed the latest earnings results and the impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Corporate America.

item.title: China Drops to No. 3 Holder of Treasuries, Falling Behind UK
item.description: China shrank its holdings of US Treasuries in March, with the UK replacing it as the No. 2 overseas owner.
item.dc:creator: Liz Capo McCormick

item.title: Coinbase Boosted by S&P 500 Inclusion Despite Hack, Probe Risks
item.description: Coinbase Global Inc.’s rally has been unconquerable this week, as even a one-two punch of negative headlines did little to stop the crypto exchange operator’s climb ahead of its inclusion in the S&P 500 Index.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin

media:content.media:description: Monitors display Coinbase signage during the company's initial public offering (IPO) at the Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, U.S., on Wednesday, April 14, 2021. Coinbase Global Inc., the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange, is set to debut on Wednesday through a direct listing, an alternative to a traditional initial public offering that has only been deployed a handful of times. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Hedge Funds Boost Bullish Bets on Brent on US-China Trade Truce
item.description: Hedge funds boosted bullish bets in Brent crude to the highest in five weeks as the world’s two biggest economies ratcheted down trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Devika Krishna Kumar

item.title: Chicago Taps EY to Close $1 Billion Gap as Trump Threatens Funds
item.description: Chicago is hiring Ernst & Young LLP to help the city slash costs and close budget gaps that are forecast to top $1 billion in each of the next two years.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Singh

media:content.media:description: The skyline of Chicago, Illinois, US, on Tuesday, Aug. 13, 2024. Chicago is delaying its $643 million bond sale that was expected to price last week amid volatility in the $4 trillion market for state and local bonds.

item.title: Druckenmiller’s Duquesne Slashes Successful Argentina Bet by 19%
item.description: ARGT has paid off handsomely since the firm started building the position in early 2024
item.dc:creator: Katie Greifeld

media:content.media:description: Stan Druckenmiller, chairman and chief executive officer and founder of Duquesne Family Office LLC, during a Bloomberg Television interview in New York, US, on Wednesday, Oct. 16, 2024. Billionaire investor Stanley Druckenmiller is concerned that the Federal Reserve has boxed itself into a corner when it comes to future interest-rate cuts. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump’s Crypto Project Pushes Back on Senate Inquiry
item.description: Attorneys for Donald Trump’s World Liberty Financial crypto project pushed back against claims about potential conflicts of interest raised by the Democratic head of a Senate investigative subcommittee.
item.dc:creator: Teresa Xie, Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: The World Liberty Financial website arranged on a smartphone in New York, US, on Wednesday, Feb. 12, 2025. Chase Herro, co-founder of President Donald Trump's DeFi project, World Liberty Financial, said the platform plans on creating a strategic reserve with tokens bought.

item.title: Oil Climbs as Iran Casts Doubt on US Nuclear Deal Negotiations
item.description: Oil rose after Iran’s foreign minister downplayed prospects for a breakthrough in nuclear talks with the US, saying no formal proposal had been received.
item.dc:creator: Devika Krishna Kumar, Christopher Charleston, Alex Longley

media:content.media:description: Production facilities for ethane, methanol and sulfur petrochemicals stand at the Bushehr Petrochemical Co. plant during construction work in the Pars Special Economic and Energy Zone in Asaluyeh, Iran, on Monday, July 8, 2019. Shipping in the Middle East is getting ever riskier, with a standoff between the U.K. navy and Iran just the latest in a line of incidents in the region over the past few months. Photographer: Ali Mohammadi/Bloomberg

item.title: Fed to Cut 10% of Workforce Over 2 Years | Bloomberg Markets 05/16/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Edward Jones Senior Global Investment Strategist Angelo Kourkafas, Bloomberg's Michael Mckee, Geetha Rangananthan, Sri Taylor, and Janet Lorin. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Untouched Muni Tax Perk Eases Urge to Flood the Market
item.description: Municipal bond investors likely felt relief this week when a draft tax bill didn’t erase the all-important tax exemption, but that respite may cool this year’s market for state and local governments seeking cash.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Rembert

media:content.media:description: Contractors install traffic control lights on an on-ramp to west bound Interstate 80 in El Cerrito, California, US, on Monday, May 5, 2025. High-yield municipal bonds posted their worst month since September 2023 as the securities struggle to recoup losses from the tariff-fueled selloff earlier this month.

item.title: Fed to Shrink Staff by About 10% Over Next Few Years
item.description: The federal reserve plans to shrink its workforce by about 10% over the next few years, offering some employees deferred resignation, according to a memo viewed by Bloomberg News.The Fed has drawn Musk’s attention, including its multi-year headquarters renovation. Bloomberg's Mike McKee reports (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sentiment Data Keeps Fed Alert: PGIM's Tipp
item.description: PGIM Fixed Income Chief Investment Strategist and Head of Global Bonds Robert Tipp says the University of Michigan sentiment survey data shows good numbers. Nuveen Head of Fixed Income Strategy Tony Rodriguez sees some modest pressure lower in yields next 6 to 18 months. They speak with Dani Burger on "Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Gold Set for Biggest Weekly Drop Since November on Peace Talks
item.description: Gold is headed for its biggest weekly loss in six months as Russia and Ukraine began their first direct talks in more than three years.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross, Jack Ryan

media:content.media:description: An employee handles one kilogram gold bullions at the YLG Bullion International Co. headquarters in Bangkok, Thailand, on Friday, Dec. 22, 2023. Gold headed for a weekly gain after US price data came in cooler than forecast, reinforcing expectations for multiple interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve next year. Photographer: Chalinee Thirasupa/Bloomberg
